area_name: Pine Crest Trail Boulders aka Lakeside Boulders

content.description: In low water conditions start low on jugs and climb up and right through overhang and traverse around to slab on crack and top on Lake Lizard or Aztec Warrior In high water don’t get waterlogged!
content.location: Left of Boat Dock Rock slab #21 on topo

content.description: Sit under small roof and climb up and over it
content.location: Left side of uphill boulders #9 on topo

content.description: Sit start with RH on jug on arete and LH on crimps climb straight up thin face (left arete is off)
content.location: Above Pontoon Goon on Tree boulder and right of tree#26 on topo

content.description: Sit start on pockets and climb straight to top
content.location: Left of tree on the Tree boulder #25 on topo

content.description: Stand start in middle of face and climb up to the three little birds hold (3 small chicken heads) and top out
content.location: on middle of the Hillside boulders#12 on topo

content.description: Start the climb as far right as you can on the long, low, flat edge. One of the cruxes is not dabbing at the beginning. Traverse the face left and move around the arete and finally finish with Doggy Paddle.  Super great/pumpy climb for the area.
content.location: Lakeside boulder #30 on topo

content.description: A fun, but contrived power problem. Sit start on the short steep face on the backside of the Fishing Hole Boulder on two chalked sloping crimps. Avoiding the large holds out left, move up and right to a sloping pinch/crimp, the fire up and left for another slopey pinch. Definitely an eliminate, but still fun.
content.location: Backside of the Fishing Hole Boulder#7 on topo

content.description: Climb slab left of Up and Over
content.location: Left side of hillside boulder #10 on topo

content.description: Sit start low on crimps and climb up to easier ground
content.location: #37 on topo

content.description: Sit start under left arete and climb straight up through bulge and slopers to top
content.location: Lakeside boulder #29 on topo

content.description: Stand start and climb the arete
content.location: Right of Cavity Not on topo

content.description: Sit on sloper crimps and go straight up arete
content.location: Same start as Snagged #6 on topo

content.description: Clean arete face with a beautiful background for that perfect photo opportunity. Sit start low on two pockets right side of arete. Utilize crimps and pockets to climb straight up the arete to an easy top out.
content.location: On the lake, to the right of Aztec Warrior#24 on topo

content.description: This is the area test piece!  Sit start on underclings and move to crimps and up through pocket and edges.The stand starts on crimps and is V6
content.location: On the Black Tooth Boulder#41 on topo

content.description: Start standing on sloper crimp and traverse right on weakness and top out on slopers at high point
content.location: Cloud Nine boulder #32 on topo

content.description: Pull past a hand ledge and navigate big pockets to an easy top out. Try not to disturb the bird nests!
content.location: Located on boat dock rock as looking at the lake it’s on the right side just above the water#20 on topo

content.description: Sit start under crack and climb up
content.location: #36 on topo

content.description: Climb up tallest part of boulder to top out for a beautiful view.
content.location: On the Tree boulder the slab right of areteNot on topo

content.description: A few different routes on this one. Can climb up the side ​where there's a crack, or can start on the side and traverse left onto the ledge and top out.
content.location: Up the hill a little bit from boat dock rock. Should basically run into it from the Pinecrest loop trail (blue blazes)Not on topo but back side of Lake Pirate boulder

content.description: Sit start below obvious arete and use big edges layback and continue to top
content.location: Left arete on middle hillside boulder #11 on topo

content.description: Sit start on crimps low on center or face
content.location: Lake Pirate boulder #39 on topo

content.description: Stand start on left side of the slab with back to lake and climb slab to top many variations
content.location: Boat Dock Rock #22 on topo

content.description: Sit start on pockets and work up and over the bulge and top on slopers
content.location: Boulder below Black tooth boulder  #35 on topo

content.description: The variety of holds and quality of movement make this one worth checking out. Start in the low dual pockets and work your way up a sloper and crimp rails to gain the slab face and climb to top (this one may need some cleaning)
content.location: On the wall above the fishing hole boulder.#16 on topo

content.description: Starts sitting on huge jug beneath the crack splitting the tall face. Work up into the crack and make a few more moves to an easy heady topout
content.location: On the right side of the hillside boulders obvious crack#17 on topo

content.description: Steep, solid rock that offers the best warm ups in the area. As its covered with all sorts of holds many variations exist but for Fishlips start low on jugs and aim for the big jug shaped like a fish mouth then go straight up through jugs to slabby easy top
content.location: The steep, pocketed face of the Fishing Hole Boulder#3 on topo

content.description: Start by climbing up the part protruding from underneath the boulder so you can reach good crimps. Slightly traverse right on decent feet and figure out how to use the diagonal rails to reach the huge jug slightly beneath the top. Be Careful topping out.
content.protection: 2 or 3 crash pads would be ideal.
content.location: On the face that is facing directly towards the water on the same boulder as "Cloud Nine".#34 on topo

content.description: Sit start on pockets and climb the left side of the face
content.location: Lake Pirate boulder #40 on topo

content.description: Stand below big hold and climb up face to top
content.location: Left side of hillside boulders #13 on topo

content.description: Sit start on the under cling on the left and heel hook the right side of the arete. Find the slopers  and a super easy top out. Hardest part is the first two moves.
content.location: Left side of Hillside boulders or above the fishing hole boulder from here look uphill #8 on topo

content.description: Sit start on low right side and use crimp rails to climb up and left to high point Top edge is off
content.location: Lake Pirate boulder #38 on topo

content.description: Sit start same as Flying High Again and move right and work your way to standing on ledge just right of crack and then use slopers to gain easier ground to top (keep your head about you it’s spicy at the top but easy)
content.location: Just right of the obvious crack on the left hillside boulder #18 on topo

content.description: Stand start on jugs and move up left or straight up to top#27 on topo
content.location: On the Lakeside Boulder

content.description: Climb face left of Music on the Lake
content.location: On boat dock rock #19 on topo

content.description: Sit start left hand on small knob like feature, right hand on pocket. Straight up through crimps and over the ledge. Top out through the grass or traverse left and out once over the ledge.
content.protection: Pads and spotter, top out is heady and grassy, but doable.
content.location: Left most problem on the boulder#14 on topo

content.description: Climb obvious crack feature right of Bite Me
content.location: On the Black Tooth boulder #43 on topo

content.description: Start below small overhang and move up and left to slopers to easier ground and top
content.location: Cloud Nine boulder#31 on topo

content.description: The tall attractive lakeside arete. Start on underclings with a large ledge foot and figure out how to reach distant holds higher up on the arete.
content.location: On the lakeshore #33 on topo

content.description: Stand start right hand in small one finger cavity and left on edges move straight up the face to top
content.location: On the Black tooth boulder#44 on topo

content.description: Sit low in pockets and climb up and left to top
content.location: Left side of Fishing Hole boulder’s overhanging face#1 on topo

content.description: Starts on a bean shaped iron feature on the right side of the clean white face. Climb sharp holds to an easy topout.This line has a sit start that makes it V3
content.location: Black Tooth Boulder#42 on topo

content.description: Start in pockets below big hole climb right into big hole and then straight to top
content.location: Left of Flying high again #15 on topo

content.description: Sit start below left leaning flake and climb up through flake to top
content.location: On the Fishing Hole boulder #2 on topo

content.description: Sit start same as Angler but trend right a little and straight up big face on big holds to highest point on boulder
content.location: Lakeside of the fishing hole boulder #5 on topo

content.description: Same start as Doggy Paddle but after establishing yourself beneath the roof, climb to the right and out the imposing bulge. Big holds and some air under your feet.#28 on topo
content.protection: A few crashpads and attentive spotters
content.location: Lakeside boulder

content.description: Climb the rails and jugs on the slab to a nice top out and enjoy the view.
content.location: Located at Boat Dock Rock platform on the water on the edge.#23 on topo

content.description: Sit start on low on flake and then follow good holds up and left to the angling arete cross over arete and top out same as Fishlips
content.location: Lakeside face of the Fishing Hole Boulder#4 on topo

pathTokens: Pine Crest Trail Boulders aka Lakeside Boulders

content.description: The showpiece boulders of Salt Fork State Park!  This is a nice concentration of easy to moderate problems but hard lines like “Novocaine” and “Cloud Nine” will test even the strongest climbers!  The boulders are right off the Pine Crest Loop trail below a quiet pine forest and above a beautiful lake! Come out and enjoy…Problems are listed as you come to them from the trailhead. The lines listed here were developed as far back as the late 1980s and early 1990s. Most of these lines are pure and independent.This is new, revised, updated, and corrected to reflect historical accuracy of the area!  This area is historically known as the Pine Crest Trail boulders as all boulders at Salt Fork are lakeside and can be confusing so the name may be changed in the near future.
